CatDescriptText: Miss Shirley Nelson, nurses' aide, 104 Strauss Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads:  "We should build our own.  In that way, we are using something that our own people built and therefore we will be helping our own."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Shirley Nelson wearing herringbone coat with fur collar and dark buttons, posed in front of building
